resources.string: Oxy is a cutting-edge Smart Air Sanitizer and Real-time Indoor Air Pollution Monitoring System designed specifically for the College of Sciences Technology and Communication Inc. Senior High School classrooms.

The objective of Oxy is to develop a smart air sanitation system with mobile application, equipped with an indoor air pollution monitoring system specifically design for school classrooms to reduce indoor air contaminants and pollutants that can help maintain a healthy environment and better indoor air quality.
Oxy provides continuous monitoring of indoor air quality parameters such as particulate such as Volatile Organic compounds (VOC) and Carbon Monoxide (CO).
Oxy is equipped with smart air sanitization technology to eliminate pollutants, presence of harmful air pollutants like bacteria, viruses in air.

The AQI or Air Quality Index is an index for reporting daily air quality. It tells you how clean or polluted your air is, and what associated health effects might be a concern for you. The AQI focuses on health effects you may experience within a few hours or days after breathing polluted air.
| Air quality is satisfactory, and air pollution poses little or no risk.
| Air quality is acceptable. However, there may be a risk for some people, particularly those who unusually sensible to air pollution.
| Members of sensitive groups may experience health effect. The general public is less like to be affected.
| Everyone may begin to experience health effects; members of sensitive groups may experience more serious health effects.
| Health warnings of emergency conditions. The entire population is more likely affected.
| Health alert: everyone may experience more serious health effects.

Welcome to the Oxy - Smart Air Sanitizer and Real-time Indoor Air Pollution Monitoring System! These terms govern the usage of the System and incorporate provisions addressing human error or intervention.
Ensure proper placement of Oxy units within each classroom for optimal air circulation.

The administrator will provide the application along with the account that has also been furnished by the admin. Download and install the Oxy mobile application that was given by the administrator. Connect the application to the Oxy system using the provided credentials. Follow the on-screen instructions for initial setup.
Open the Oxy mobile application to view real-time air quality data. Monitor parameters Volatile Organic compounds (VOC) and Carbon Monoxide (CO).

It has automated feature that starts the sanitation automatically when the air quality is at unhealthy level. Additionally, whenever you want to sanitize, you have given the Sanitize button, sanitize indoor air in just one click

By utilizing the Oxy System, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agreed to comply with the following terms and conditions. Should any part of these terms be disagreeable to you, refrain from using the System.

The Oxy - Smart Air Sanitizer and Android mobile application is exclusively accessible to Senior High School faculty members including teachers and Program Head, Utility Personnel, members of the College of Sciences Technology and Communication Inc. Senior High School.

Users are required to use an account provided by the administrator to access the System and Android application. All information provided during the account creation process must be accurate, and users are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of their account credentials.
The Institution reserves the right to suspend, modify, or terminate user access to the System at its sole discretion, without prior notice.
Unauthorized attempts to access, modify, or tamper with the System or its components are strictly prohibited. Any such attempts may result in disciplinary action and legal consequences.
The Oxy - Smart Air Sanitizer is provided solely to enhance indoor air quality within designated Senior High School classrooms.

Users are strictly prohibited from tampering with, dismantling, or misusing the Oxy device. Any unauthorized modifications or interference, including human error, may result in termination of account.

The Oxy - Smart Air Sanitizer collects real-time indoor air pollution data for monitoring purposes. Users acknowledge that errors, inaccuracies, or discrepancies may arise due to human intervention or system malfunctions.
The Institution is committed to protecting user privacy. Personal information collected will be handled in accordance with applicable data protection laws and the Institution\'s privacy policy.
Users must adhere to all applicable laws and regulations while using the System.

Users are encouraged to promptly report any issues, concerns, or malfunctions related to the Oxy - Smart Air Sanitizer including those arising from human error, to the relevant authorities such as the administrator.

The Institution and developers shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages arising out of or in connection with the use of the System, including those resulting from human error or intervention.
The CSTC Institution reserves the right to modify or revise these terms at any time. Users will be notified of significant changes through appropriate channels.
The Institution may terminate user access to the system at any time for violation of these terms or any other reason deemed appropriate by the Institution.

By using the Oxy, you acknowledge and agree to the terms and conditions outlined above, recognizing the potential for errors or interventions, whether intentional or unintentional. Failure to comply with these terms may result in the suspension or termination of your access to the system.

The Android mobile application allows user to monitor and control the Oxy system. Users can receive real-time notifications, view historical data, and conduct sanitation, monitor the quality of indoor air.
Oxy\'s mobile application features an intuitive interface with easy-to-understand visualizations of air quality data.

The Oxy smart device is composed of sensors that is capable of detecting indoor air quality. Within the smart device, there is also a smart air sanitizer with the ability to release mist for sanitation. An exhaust fan is also attached to expel the sanitized air or remove contaminated air after the sanitation process.
